name: ethnologically
content:

in a way that relates to the study of different societies and cultures: She ethnologically evaluates the mindset and actions of wealthy fashion entrepreneurs. The area was quite distinct both ethnologically and linguistically. See
ethnological
More examplesFewer examplesThis population is ethnologically and culturally similar to Tibetans.The lives of the people will not be reflected in the dance in a literal or ethnologically accurate way.The region is geographically and ethnologically removed from the rest of the country.
